column2: NEW JERSEY DMV PRACTICE TEST
column6: NJ

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column4: The last driver to reach the intersection.
column6: No one.
column8: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.

column2: 2. Braking distance is affected by:
column6: the condition of your brakes and tires.
column8: the speed your vehicle is traveling.

column2: 3. Before turning, you should:
column6: give the proper turn signal.
column8: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.

column2: 4. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column6: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column8: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.

column2: 5. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column6: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column10: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.

column2: 6. This sign means:
column6: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 7. A 5 oz. glass of wine contains the same amount of alcohol as:
column6: a 6-pack of beer.

column2: 8. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

column2: 9. This sign warns drivers that:
column6: they cannot go straight ahead.
column10: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 10. This sign means:
column6: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column8: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column6: Sharp curve ahead

column2: 12. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column6: enter the intersection and then stop.
column8: wait for the next green light.
column10: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.

column2: 13. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column6: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column8: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column10: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.

column2: 14. When driving on a wet road:
column4: as you drive faster, your tires may lose traction.
column6: as you decrease your speed, the road becomes more slippery.
column8: you should follow the vehicle ahead of you more closely.
column10: you must be aware that the pavement gets even more slippery when it's been raining for long periods of time.

column2: 15. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column6: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.
column8: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column10: wait until traffic ahead is clear.

column2: 16. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column6: None of the other answers is correct.
column10: stay in the center of your lane

column2: 17. Your blind spot is the area of the road:
column4: you see in your rearview mirror.
column6: you see in your side mirror.
column10: you cannot see without moving your head.

column2: 18. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
column6: a crossbuck sign.

column2: 19. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column6: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column8: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.

column2: 20. When driving, it is important to keep a space cushion _______ of your vehicle.
column6: only on the left and right side

column2: 21. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column6: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)

column2: 22. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column6: the direction they should travel.
column10: that there's a school zone ahead.

column2: 23. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: steer the car into the direction of the skid.
column6: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column8: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column10: tap the gas pedal with their foot.

column2: 24. When changing lanes, you should:
column6: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.
column8: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.
column10: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.

column2: 25. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column6: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column10: you are not allowed to park here.

column2: 26. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column6: furious driving

column2: 27. This traffic sign warns you about:
column6: a winding road.
column8: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.

column2: 28. When you drive near parks and playgrounds, you should expect children:
column4: to know when it is safe to cross.
column6: to suddenly run into the street.
column8: to stop at the curb before crossing the street.
column10: not to cross unless they are with an adult.

column2: 29. This sign means:
column6: You must stop ahead
column10: You must yield the right-of-way ahead

column2: 30. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
column6: the right side

column2: 31. This road sign means:
column6: No right turn

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column6: No trucks allowed

column2: 33. This road sign means:
column6: Sharp curves ahead

column2: 34. Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
column6: have your emergency brake on.

column2: 35. Roads are most slippery:
column6: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 36. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the left
column6: Winding road ahead
column10: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left

column2: 37. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.
column6: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
column8: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.

column2: 38. This sign is a:
column6: stop sign.

column2: 39. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column6: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.
column8: the condition and type of vehicle tires.

column2: 40. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a low place in the road.
column6: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.
column10: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 41. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column6: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column8: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column10: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.

column2: 42. BAC is expressed in:
column6: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 43. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column6: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.
column8: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column10: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.

column2: 44. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column6: get off the road and check your tires.
column10: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 45. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Not drinking over a period of time.
column6: Eating before or while you drink.

column2: 46. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column6: hill

column2: 47. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
column6: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.

column2: 48. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column6: The driver who does not control the car.

column2: 49. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column6: illegal to drink from, but permissible to transport, open containers of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column8: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column10: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.

column2: 50. Drivers under 21 years of age are considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
column6: .05% or higher.
